jumping in...


On 11 June 2012 13:27, Mike Kelly <mikekelly321@...> wrote:
>>
>>  The other approach is to add a profile link to each of the resources
>> which points to a URI which works much the same way as the link
>> relation type above i.e. inferring info/state/semantics.
>>
>
 but doesn't that require the client having to consume the entire doc first?

~~~

As a third option, how about using a "profile" parameter, as per the idea
in [1], ie:

 Content-Type: application/hal+json;profile="com.mycompany.myapp.Order"

Dan

[1] http://buzzword.org.uk/2009/draft-inkster-profile-parameter-00.html

--e89a8ff1c3263a3ec104c231d213
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
